text: Daniel Kirkwood "Kirk" Fordice Jr. (February 10, 1934 - September 7, 2004), was an American politician and businessman. He was the 61st Governor of Mississippi from 1992 to 2000. He was the first Republican governor of the state since Reconstruction-era and the first governor elected to two consecutive four-year terms. Fordice was a staunch conservative. ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2004 deaths Category:Deaths from leukemia Category:Businesspeople from Memphis, Tennessee Category:Governors of Mississippi Category:Politicians from Memphis, Tennessee Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Kirk Fordice
